description.p: One of the most dangerous obsessions an artificer can pursue has always been mechanical flight. Many strive for this lofty goal, and all but the most dedicated, and often the most foolhardy, artificers fail in their pursuits. Experiments that end in disastrous explosions, catastrophic falls from the sky, and deadly malfunctions are not out of the norm for an Aeronaut perfecting their mechanical flying machine.
You constantly strive to achieve the lofty goal of every Aeronaut, the creation of an arcane flying machine.

sheet.description: Aeronauts constantly try to achieve the lofty goal of creating an arcane flying machine.

description.p: At 3rd level, you gain proficiency with woodcarver's tools. If you are already proficient in woodcarver's tools you gain proficiency with another type of artisan's tools of your choice.

Starting at 3rd level, at the end of a long rest, you can use your woodcarver's tools to construct a Flying Machine. You choose the Machine's appearance, but it has no effect on its abilities. Your Flying Machine has the following features:

ul.li: It can be used as a spellcasting focus by you.
It is built to fit you, and can be worn over light armor.
When you fall, and aren't incapacitated, you subtract up to 100 feet from your fall when calculating falling damage, and can move 2 feet horizontally every 1 foot you fall.
You gain a flying speed of 15 feet, which increases as you gain levels in this class; at 5th level (20 feet), 9th level (30 feet), and in finally at 15th level (60 feet).
When you make a weapon attack while at least 5 feet off the ground, you can use your Intelligence, in place of Strength or Dexterity, for the attack and damage rolls.
You can only have one Flying Machine at a time, and creating another causes the other to fall into disrepair.

description.p: Beginning at 5th level, you can attack twice, rather than once, whenever you take the Attack action on your turn.
Starting at 9th level, while wearing your Flying Machine, you can take the Dash action as a bonus action on your turn.
In addition, while you have your flying machine equipped, you gain a bonus to your Dexterity ability checks and saving throws equal to your Intelligence modifier (minimum of +1).

You have become a master of Aeronaut artifice. Beginning at 15th level, while wearing your Flying Machine and you are subjected to an effect that allows you to make a Dexterity saving throw to take only half damage, you instead take no damage if you succeed, and only half damage if you fail.

For centuries chroniclers have sought the best way to store vast amounts of information. Where most are satisfied with scrolls, Archivists strove for something greater. They have learned to store libraries worth of information in a single object, awakening the first Artificial Minds. Working in tandem with these wondrous Minds, Archivists wield the potentially limitless power of these arcane intelligences.
How will you use your ability to create artificial intelligence?

sheet.description: Aeronauts constantly try to achieve the lofty goal of creating an arcane flying machine.

description.p: When you become an Archivist Specialist at 3rd level, you gain proficiency with calligrapher's supplies. If you are already proficient in calligrapher's supplies you instead gain proficiency with another type of artisan's tools of your choice.

Beginning at 3rd level, you learn to awaken Artificial Minds within objects. At the end of a long rest, you can touch a Tiny, non-magical object, and use your calligrapher's supplies to awaken an Artificial Mind within it. While the Artificial Mind is awakened within an object, it is considered a magic item that requires attunement, and it can be used as a spellcasting focus for your artificer spells. If you attempt to rouse a second Artificial Mind while you already have one from this feature, the first Artificial Mind ceases to exist. While attuned to your Artificial Mind, you gain the following abilities:

Information Overload. You can cause your Artificial Mind to overload the mind's of your foes by channeling information at them. As an action, you can force a creature that you can see within 30 feet to make an Intelligence saving throw. On a failed save, it takes 1d8 psychic damage and disadvantage on the next attack roll it makes before the start of your next turn.
The damage of Information Overload increases when you reach 5th level (2d8), 11th level (3d8), and 17th level (4d8).
Magical Telepathy. You can communicate telepathically with any creature carrying one of your infused items within a 1-mile radius. The creature can respond telepathically.

Skill Proficiencies. You gain proficiency in two skills of your choice from the column on the Artificial Mind table. The material of the object determines the skills you choose from, as the object's nature affects the mind's knowledge.

sheet.description: Touch a Tiny non-magical object with your calligrapher's supplies to awaken an Artificial Mind within it, turning it into a magical item that requires attunement and can be used as your spellcasting focus. You can only have one at a time, and it grants you the ability to use Information Overload, Magical Telephony, and two skill proficiencies based on its material (see table).

description.p: You can cause your Artificial Mind to overload the mind's of your foes by channeling information at them. As an action, you can force a creature that you can see within 30 feet to make an Intelligence saving throw. On a failed save, it takes 1d8 psychic damage and disadvantage on the next attack roll it makes before the start of your next turn.
Also, when you deal psychic damage using your Artificial Mind as a spellcasting focus, you gain a bonus to the damage roll equal to your Intelligence modifier (minimum of +1).

sheet.description: Force a visible creature within 30 ft. to make an Intelligence saving throw; if it fails, it takes 1d8 psychic damage and has disadvantage on its next attack roll before your next turn.

Force a visible creature within 30 ft. to make an Intelligence saving throw; if it fails, it takes 1d8 psychic damage and has disadvantage on its next attack roll before your next turn. You can expend a spell slot to increase the damage by 2d8 + 1d8 for each additional slot level beyond the 1st.

description.p: You can communicate telepathically with any creature carrying one of your infused items within a 1-mile radius. The creature can respond telepathically.

sheet.description: You can telepathically communicate in both directions with any creature carrying one of your infused items within a 1-mi. radius.

description.p: Starting at 5th level, you can expend a spell slot to increase the psychic damage of Information Overload. The damage increases by 2d8 for a 1st-level spell slot, and an additional 1d8 for each spell level higher than 1st-level.
Also, when you deal psychic damage using your Artificial Mind as a spellcasting focus, you gain a bonus to the damage roll equal to your Intelligence modifier (minimum of +1).

sheet.description: When you deal psychic damage with your Artifical Mind as your spellcasting focus, deal an additional +{{intelligence:modifier}} damage.

description.p: The cognitive abilities of your Artificial Mind are powerful enough to aid your spellcasting. Starting at 9th level, when you are forced to make a Constitution saving throw to maintain concentration on a spell, you gain a bonus to your roll equal to your Intelligence modifier (minimum of +1).

sheet.description: When you are forced to make a Constitution saving throw to maintain spell concentration, add +{{intelligence:modifier}} to your roll.

description.p: You are a master of Archivist artifice. Starting at 15th level, you can an action on your to transform into pure information and teleport to an unoccupied space that you can see within 60 feet, or an unoccupied space within 5 feet of a creature or object bearing one of your artificer Infusions.

sheet.description: Teleport to a visible unoccupied space within 60 ft., or an unoccupied space within 5 ft. of a creature or object bearing one of your Artificial Infusions.

description.p: While most artificers are content with mechanical innovation, some see biology, the science of living things, as an area rife with potential. Biomancers are those who use their talents to supplement their own anatomy and create life. Combining necromancy and transmutation magic, Biomancers see all living things as prototypes that can be magically evolved.

sheet.description: Biomancers are those who use their talents to supplement their own anatomy and create life.

description.p: At 3rd level, you gain proficiency with leatherworker's tools. If you are already proficient in leatherworker's tools you gain proficiency with another type of artisan's tools of your choice.

You can use your understanding of Biomancy magic to create an aberrant life form. Starting at 3rd level, whenever you cast find familiar, you instead create a Chimera, which functions as a normal familiar, but has the following changes:

ul.li: The material component is 1 pound of organic matter.
It is a monstrosity (instead of a celestial, fey, or fiend).
It has additional hit points equal to your artificer level.
As an action, the Chimera can touch a creature and sacrifice any amount of its hit points, healing the target for the same amount by grafting its flesh to theirs.

description.p: As an action, the Chimera can merge with a creature it can touch, granting it temporary hit points equal to the Chimera's remaining hit points. While merged, the target gains one of the Chimeric Traits below. The creatures remain merged until you create another Chimera, or the temporary hit points are depleted, at which point the Chimera is destroyed.
Amphibious Physiology. While merged, the creature can breathe both air and water, and gains a 30 foot swim speed.
Resilient Hide.While merged and not wearing any armor or using a shield, the creature's Armor Class is equal to 10 + your Intelligence modifier + their Constitution modifier.

Vestigial Limb. While merged, the creature grows an additional limb which resembles their own limbs. It has a reach of 5 feet, and can lift a number of pounds equal to your Intelligence score. The limb can't use weapons or shields nor can it do anything that requires manual precision.

sheet.description: When you cast find familiar, you create a Chimera instead, using 1 lb. of organic matter as the material component. It is a monstrosity with an additional +{{level:artificer}} hit points. As an action, it can touch a creature and heal it any amount of hit points by sacrificing its own; if can also merge itself entirely with the target, granting it a Chimeric Trait. Amphibious Physiology: Grant the creature a 30 ft. swim speed, and it can breathe both air and water. Resilient Hide: Grant the creature 10 + {{intelligence:modifier}} + their Constitution modifier while they are not wearing armor or using a shield. Vestigial Limb: Grant the creature an additional limb with 5 ft. reach that cannot use weapons or perform dextrous tastks but can lift up to {{intelligence:score}} lbs.

description.p: The power your Chimera works best when merged with its master. Starting at 5th level, you gain the following benefits while you are merged with your Aberrant Chimera:

ul.li: Whenever you make an attack or damage roll, ability check, or saving throw that would normally use your Strength, you can use your Intelligence score instead.
You gain a climbing speed equal to your movement speed, and you can climb difficult surfaces, including upside down on ceilings, without making an ability check.

As a bonus action, you can expend a spell slot to grant yourself temporary hit points equal to five times the level of the spell slot + your Intelligence modifier. These temporary hit points are added to any temporary hit points you have from merging with your Aberrant Chimera.

description.p: Also starting at 5th level, you can attack twice, rather than once, whenever you take the Attack action on your turn.
You have enhanced your own physiology with strange magic. At 9th level, your movement speed increases by 10 feet, and you permanently gain one Chimeric Trait of your choice.
When you reach 15th level in this class, you gain a second permanent Chimeric Trait of your choice (for a total of two).
While merged, the creature can breathe both air and water, and gains a 30 foot swim speed.
While merged and not wearing any armor or using a shield, the creature's Armor Class is equal to 10 + your Intelligence modifier + their Constitution modifier.

While merged, the creature grows an additional limb which resembles their own limbs. It has a reach of 5 feet, and can lift a number of pounds equal to your Intelligence score. The limb can't use weapons or shields nor can it do anything that requires manual precision.

sheet.description: You have an additional limb with 5 ft. reach; it cannot wield weapons or shields or perform dextrous tasks, but it can lift up to {{intelligence:score}} lbs.

description.p: You have become a master amongst Biomancer artificers. Beginning at 15th level, when you target a creature with a Biomancer Spell, you can grant a single target (additional) temporary hit points equal to your artificer level.

sheet.description: When you target creatures with a Biomancer spell, you can grant single target {{level:artificer}} temporary hit points.

description.p: For those that pursue the magic of artifice, no area of study is too dangerous. Perhaps against their better judgment, some artificers choose to experiment with Chronomancy, the magic of time. Known as Chronothieves, these bold artificers are marked by their signature Chronometers, a wondrous object which they use to steal moments and adjust the flow of time.

sheet.description: Chronothieves are marked by their signature Chronometers, a wondrous object which they use to steal moments and adjust the flow of time.

description.p: At 3rd level, you gain proficiency with jeweler's tools. If you are already proficient with jeweler's tools, you instead gain proficiency with another set of artisan's tools of your choice.

At 3rd level, you can create a Chronometer, marking you as a true Chronothief. At the end of a long rest, you can use your jeweler's tools to construct a Tiny timekeeping device, like a watch, hourglass, or small sun dial, which can be used as a spellcasting focus by you for your artificer spells.
You can only have one Chronometer at a time, and creating another causes the magic within the first to dissipate.

Your Chronometer has a number of charges equal to twice your Intelligence modifier. It regains all expended charges when you finish a long rest. While your Chronometer is in hand, you can expend a charge to use the following abilities:
Accelerate. As an action, you increase the speed of a creature within 60 feet by a number feet equal to 5 times your Intelligence modifier until the end of their next turn.

Decelerate. As an action, you force a creature that within 60 feet to make a Charisma saving throw. On a failed save, its movement speed is reduced by a number feet equal to 5 times your Intelligence modifier until the end of its next turn.

Slip. As a reaction when a creature within 60 feet makes an attack roll, ability check, or saving throw, you can force them to re-roll. You must use this reaction before you know if the triggering attack, check, or saving throw succeed.

Warp. As an action, you can switch places with a creature within 60 feet, each instantly teleporting to the other's space. An unwilling creature must succeed on a Charisma saving throw or be forced to switch places with you.

sheet.description: After a long rest, you can construct a Tiny Chronometer that can be used as your focus; you can only have one at a time. It has {{chronometer:charges}}, and regains them after a long rest.

description.p: As an action, you increase the speed of a creature within 60 feet by a number feet equal to 5 times your Intelligence modifier until the end of their next turn.

sheet.description: Increase the speed of a creature within 60 ft. by {{accelerate speed}} until the end of their next turn.
Increase the speed of a creature within 60 ft. by {{accelerate speed}} until the end of their next turn.
Increase the speed of a creature within 60 ft. by {{accelerate speed}} until the end of their next turn; opportunity attacks against it also have disadvantage until the end of their next turn.

description.p: As an action, you force a creature that within 60 feet to make a Charisma saving throw. On a failed save, its movement speed is reduced by a number feet equal to 5 times your Intelligence modifier until the end of its next turn.

sheet.description: Force a creature within 60 ft. to make a Charisma saving throw; if it fails, its movement speed is reduced by {{decelerate speed}} until the end of their its turn.
Force a creature within 60 ft. to make a Charisma saving throw; if it fails, its movement speed is reduced by {{decelerate speed}} until the end of their its turn.

Force a creature within 60 ft. to make a Charisma saving throw; if it fails, its movement speed is reduced by {{decelerate speed}} until the end of their its turn. You can spend an additional charge to double the reduction; if this reduces its speed to 0, it must succeed on a Constitution saving throw or be stunned until the end of its next turn.

description.p: As a reaction when a creature within 60 feet makes an attack roll, ability check, or saving throw, you can force them to re-roll. You must use this reaction before you know if the triggering attack, check, or saving throw succeed.

sheet.description: When a creature within 60 ft. makes an attack roll, ability check, or saving throw, force it to reroll, before you know if it has succeeded.

When a creature within 60 ft. makes an attack roll, ability check, or saving throw, force it to reroll, before you know if it has succeeded. If you spend two charges to use this reaction, you can do so even after knowing the result.

description.p: As an action, you can switch places with a creature within 60 feet, each instantly teleporting to the other's space. An unwilling creature must succeed on a Charisma saving throw or be forced to switch places with you.

sheet.description: Switch places with a creature within 60 ft. instantly; an unwilling creature can make a Charisma saving throw to resist the switch on a success.
Switch places with a creature within 60 ft. instantly; an unwilling creature can make a Charisma saving throw to resist the switch on a success.

Switch places with a creature within 60 ft. instantly; an unwilling creature can make a Charisma saving throw to resist the switch on a success. You can spend additional charges to increase the range by 30 ft. by charge.

description.p: You have improved your Chronometer so that you can literally save moments in time for later. Beginning at 5th level, when you successfully paralyze, stun, or reduce a creature's movement speed to 0 with a spell or Chronothief ability, your Chronometer regains one of its expended charges.
Also, any of your Chronometer abilities that require an action to use can also be used as a bonus action on your turn.

sheet.description: When you successfully paralyze, stun, or reduce a creature's movement speed to 0 with a spell or Chronothief ability, your Chronometer regains 1 expended charge.

description.p: Your understanding and control over the magic of time has greatly increased. Upon reaching 9th level in this class, the magic of your Chronometer improves in the following ways:
You can only have one Chronometer at a time, and creating another causes the magic within the first to dissipate.

Your Chronometer has a number of charges equal to twice your Intelligence modifier. It regains all expended charges when you finish a long rest. While your Chronometer is in hand, you can expend a charge to use the following abilities:
Accelerate. Opportunity attacks against the target creature have disadvantage until the end of their next turn.

Decelerate. You can spend an additional charge to double the movement speed reduction. If this feature reduces a target's speed to 0, it must succeed on a Constitution saving throw or be stunned until the end of its next turn.
Slip. You can spend two charges to use this reaction after you know if the triggering attack roll, ability check, or saving throw succeeded or failed.
Warp. You can spend additional charges to increase the range by an additional 30 feet for each charge you expend.
You are considered a master in the field of Chronomancy. Starting at 15th level, you can overload your Chronometer, expending any remaining charges, to cast time stop.
Once you cast time stop in this way, you must finish a long rest before you can do so again.

sheet.description: Expend all remaining charges in your Chronometer to cast time stop.

description.p: Behind every great musician, every standing ovation, every sold out concert, there is most often Composer who put quill to parchment and penned the notes. These great minds are unlike other bards and entertainers, Composers take a more cerebral approach to music. They are masters of patterns and repetition, and when they apply their analytical minds to a problem it is only a matter of time before they find a solution.
The signature invention of every Composer is their Musical Apparatus, a totally unique invention of their own design that allows them to produce wondrous musical effects.

sheet.description: Composers are are masters of patterns and repetition, and when they apply their analytical minds to a problem it is only a matter of time before they find a solution.

description.p: At 3rd level, you create a signature musical instrument. At the end of a long rest, you can use your smith's tools to create a Musical Apparatus. You are proficient with this Apparatus and it can be used as a spellcasting focus by you. When you make an ability check with your Musical Apparatus, you can add double your proficiency bonus to the result of your roll.
You can only maintain one Apparatus at a time. If you create a second, the previous Apparatus becomes unusable.
Upon creating your Musical Apparatus, you can weaponize it, choosing one of the following options below:

Raucous Blast. Your Apparatus can assault creatures with a blast of sound. As an action, make a spell attack against a creature within 60 feet that can hear you. On hit, the creature takes 1d8 thunder damage and is deafened until the start of your next turn. The damage increases by 1d8 at 5th level (2d8), and again at 11th level (3d8), and 17th level (4d8).

Ringing Strike. Your Apparatus is a simple weapon with the versatile property, and it deals 1d8 (1d10) bludgeoning damage on hit. You are considered proficient with it, and you can use your Intelligence, in place of Strength, for attack and damage rolls. In addition, you can cast the booming blade* cantrip as long as your Apparatus is the material component.

sheet.description: At the end of a long rest, use your smith's tools to craft a Musical Apparatus; you are proficient with it and can use it as your focus; you can only have one at a time. Add +{{proficiency}} to ability checks made with it.

description.p: Your Apparatus can assault creatures with a blast of sound. As an action, make a spell attack against a creature within 60 feet that can hear you. On hit, the creature takes 1d8 thunder damage and is deafened until the start of your next turn. The damage increases by 1d8 at 5th level (2d8), and again at 11th level (3d8), and 17th level (4d8).

sheet.description: Make a spell attack with your Apparatus against a creature within 60 ft. that can hear you; on hit, it takes 1d8 thunder damage and is deafend until your next turn.
Make a spell attack with your Apparatus against a creature within 60 ft. that can hear you; on hit, it takes 2d8 thunder damage and is deafend until your next turn.
Make a spell attack with your Apparatus against a creature within 60 ft. that can hear you; on hit, it takes 3d8 thunder damage and is deafend until your next turn.
Make a spell attack with your Apparatus against a creature within 60 ft. that can hear you; on hit, it takes 4d8 thunder damage and is deafend until your next turn.

description.p: Your Apparatus is a simple weapon with the versatile property, and it deals 1d8 (1d10) bludgeoning damage on hit. You are considered proficient with it, and you can use your Intelligence, in place of Strength, for attack and damage rolls. In addition, you can cast the booming blade cantrip as long as your Apparatus is the material component.

sheet.description: Your Apparatus is a simple versatile weapon that deals 1d8 (1d10) bludgeoning damage on hit, and you can use Intelligence in place of Strength for its attack and damage rolls; you are proficient with it. Additionally, you can cast booming blade with your Apparatus as the material component.

description.p: When you become a Composer Specialist at 3rd level, you gain proficiency with smith's tools and one instrument of your choice. If you already proficient with smith's tools, you gain proficiency with another set of artisan's tools of your choice.

Beginning at 5th level, when you hit a creature with a Musical Apparatus attack, you can expend a spell slot to knock Large or smaller targets back with a thunderous burst of sound. The creature is knocked back 10 feet for a 1st-level spell slot, and an additional 10 feet for each spell level higher than 1st-level.
Also, whenever you deal thunder damage, you add your Intelligence modifier (minimum of +1) to your damage roll.

sheet.description: When you hit a creature with a Musical Apparatus attack, you can expend a spell slot to knock Large or smaller targets back 10 ft. + an additional 10 ft. per slot level above the 1st.

When you hit a creature with a Musical Apparatus attack, you can expend a spell slot to knock Huge or smaller targets back 10 ft. + an additional 10 ft. per slot level above the 1st. Large or smaller creatures are also knocked prone.

description.p: Starting at 9th level, you can use an action to play a note that causes a target within 10 feet to resonate with undetectable music for 1 hour. The next time that creature is hit by a melee attack, the attacker must succeed on a Constitution saving throw or take 2d8 thunder damage and not be able take reactions until the start of their next turn.
You may use this feature a number of times equal to your Intelligence modifier (minimum of once), and you regain all expended uses when you finish a long rest.

sheet.description: Mark a target within 10 ft. for 1 hr.; the next time it is hit by a melee attack, it must make a Constitution saving throw. If it fails, it takes 2d8 thunder damage and cannot take reactions until its next turn.

Mark a target within 10 ft. for 1 hr.; the next time it is hit by a melee attack, it must make a Constitution saving throw. If it fails, it takes 4d8 thunder damage and cannot take reactions until its next turn.

description.p: You have mastered the theory and applications of musical. Beginning at 15th level, you gain the following benefits:

ul.li: You are immune to thunder damage and being deafened.
Your Musical Apparatus gains both Weaponized effects.
Your Thunderous Note feature effects Huge or smaller creatures. Large or smaller creatures that fail the saving throw fall prone at the end of their forced movement.
The damage of Resonant Frequency becomes to 4d8.

description.p: While most artificers iterate on one invention, Dungeoneers use their know-how to weaponize mundane objects. Trusted to safeguard untold riches and powerful artifacts, these slick inventors use basic adventuring gear to construct defensive traps, puzzles, and structures that can repel all but the most hardy and determined adventurers and marauders.

sheet.description: Dungeoneers use basic adventuring gear to construct defensive traps, puzzles, and structures that can repel all but the most hardy marauders.

description.p: When you become a Dungeoneer Specialist at 3rd level, you gain proficiency with carpenters and smith's tools. If you already proficient in carpenter's or smith's tools, you gain proficiency with another set of artisan's tools of your choice.

You also gain proficiency with improvised weapons. When you make an improvised weapon attack, you can use your Intelligence, in place of Strength or Dexterity, for the attack and damage rolls, and the damage die for any improvised weapon attacks you make becomes a d8 if it would be lower.

sheet.description: You are proficient with improvised weapons; you can use your Intelligence for attack and damage rolls with them, and your damage die for such attacks is a d8 if it is not higher otherwise.

You are proficient with improvised weapons; you can use your Intelligence for attack and damage rolls with them, and your damage die for such attacks is a d8 if it is not higher otherwise; they also count as magical.

description.p: Beginning at 3rd level, whenever you finish a long rest, you craft a number of objects of your choice from the table below equal to your Intelligence modifier (minimum of 1 object). They appear as mundane versions of those objects, but turn to ash the following dawn after they are created. You can craft normal versions of these objects in one quarter of the time.
If an object you craft with this feature forces a creature to make a saving throw, they use your artificer Spell Save DC.

sheet.description: At the end of a long rest, craft objects from the Dungeoncraft table that last until the following dawn; they use your Spell Save DC if they force a creature to make a saving throw.

At the end of a long rest, craft objects from the Dungeoncraft table that last until the following dawn; they count as magical when considering resistances and use your Spell Save DC if they force a creature to make a saving throw.

description.p: Beginning at 5th level, you can attack twice, rather than once, whenever you take the Attack action on your turn.
Starting at 9th level, your improvised weapon attacks and Dungeoncraft Objects are considered magical for the sake of overcoming resistance and immunity to non-magical attacks.
Also, you can cast one of your Dungeoneer Spells without providing the material component once per long rest.

sheet.description: Cast a Dungeoneer Spell without its material components.

description.p: You have become a master of Dungeoneering. Beginning at 15th level, creatures have disadvantage on saving throws for your Dungeoncraft Objects and Dunegoneer spells.

In addition, you learn to cast a ritual version of both the passwall and wall of stone spells. Casting them in this way takes 1 hour, doesn't consume a spell slot, and the structure created becomes permanent at the end of the ritual casting.

sheet.description: Creatures have disadvantage on saving throws for your Dungeoncraft Objects and Dungeoneer spells. You can cast ritual versions of the passwall and wall of stone spells; they take 1 hr., do not consume a spell slot, and create permanent structures.

description.p: While most artificers are primarily inventors that take up a life of adventure to test experiments in the field, those known as Forgewrights seek out battle for its own sake. Reveling in the thrill of combat, they combine their innovation with their skill as warriors to forge their signature Arcane Armament.

sheet.description: Forgewrights combine their innovation with their skill as warriors to forge their signature Arcane Armament.

description.p: When you become a Forgewright Specialist at 3rd level, you gain proficiency with smith's tools and all martial weapons. If you already proficient in smith's tools, you gain proficiency with another set of artisan's tools of your choice.

Your intimate knowledge of warfare and arcane magic allows you to combine both with ease. Starting at 3rd level, you learn to forge an arcane armament. At the end of each long rest, you touch one melee weapon and turn it into your arcane armament, granting it the following properties:

ul.li: The weapon you is considered magic if it was not already.
You can use your Intelligence modifier, in place of Strength or Dexterity, for the attack and damage rolls.
You gain a +1 bonus to your attack and damage rolls with it, unless the base weapon granted a higher bonus. This bonus increases at 9th level (+2) and at 15th level (+3).
It can bear one of your Infusions, even if it was already a magic item before becoming your Arcane Armament.
It gains the thrown property (range 20/60) and the returning property, and the weapon returns to your hand immediately after every ranged attack you make.

description.p: Your Arcane Armament is usable only by you. Enchanting a second weapon causes the magic imbued the first to dispel.

sheet.description: Touch a melee weapon to turn it into your Arcane Armament; you can only have one at a time and it can only be used by you. It becomes magical, gains +1 to attack and damage rolls unless its existing bonus is higher, and you can use Intelligence for the attack and damage rolls. It can also bear one of your Infusions even if already had a magic property, and it gains the thrown (range 20/60) property, returning to your hand immediately after a ranged attack.

Touch a melee weapon to turn it into your Arcane Armament; you can only have one at a time and it can only be used by you. It becomes magical, gains +2 to attack and damage rolls unless its existing bonus is higher, and you can use Intelligence for the attack and damage rolls. It can also bear one of your Infusions even if already had a magic property, and it gains the thrown (range 20/60) property, returning to your hand immediately after a ranged attack.

Touch a melee weapon to turn it into your Arcane Armament; you can only have one at a time and it can only be used by you. It becomes magical, gains +3 to attack and damage rolls unless its existing bonus is higher, and you can use Intelligence for the attack and damage rolls. It can also bear one of your Infusions even if already had a magic property, and it gains the thrown (range 20/60) property, returning to your hand immediately after a ranged attack.

description.p: Starting at 5th level, you can attack twice, instead of once, whenever you take the Attack action on your turn. Also, you can cast one of your cantrips in place of one of those attacks.

sheet.description: You can cast a cantrip in place of one of your attacks.

description.p: You can channel raw arcane power through your Armament. Beginning at 9th level, when you hit a target with your Arcane Armament you can channel arcane energy through it to create one of the following effects of your choice:

ul.li: The target takes an extra 2d6 force damage. You can expend a spell slot to increase this damage. The damage increases by 1d6 per level of the spell slot you expend.
You gain temporary hit points equal to your artificer level.
You can force the target to make a Strength saving throw. On a failed save they are knocked prone.

description.p: You can use this ability a number of times equal to your Intelligence modifier (minimum of once), and you regain all expended uses when you finish a long rest.

sheet.description: When you hit a target with your Arcane Armament, you can either (1) deal an extra 2d6 force damage, and can expend a spell slot to increase it further by 1d6 per slot level expended; (2) gain {{level:artificer}} temporary hit points; (3) force the target to make a Strength saving throw and be knocked prone if they fail

description.p: You have become a master among Forgewright artificers. Starting at 15th level, you can extend the power within your Arcane Armament to your allies. As an action, choose a number of weapons equal to your Intelligence modifier (minimum of 1) within 30 feet. For the next minute these weapons deal an additional 1d6 force damage on hit.
You can use this feature once per long rest, unless you spend a spell slot of 3rd level or higher to use it again.

sheet.description: Choose up to {{intelligence:modifier}} weapons within 30 ft.; for the next minute, they deal an additional 1d6 force damage on hit. You an expend a 3rd-leevl spell slot or higher to reuse this feature before a long rest.

description.p: While some artificers spend their lives perfection one solitary creation, Machinist artificer value quantity over quality. They are known for creating their signature Automatons, small clockwork men that are created for a single, but temporary purpose. Armed with their tools, and an army of strange and wondrous servants, Machinists are ready for any challenge.

sheet.description: Machinists are known for creating their signature Automatons, small clockwork men that are created for a single, but temporary purpose.

description.p: At 3rd level, you learn to craft Automatons. At the end of each long rest, you use your smith's tools to magically create a Small Automaton in an unoccupied space within 5 feet. Once you create an Automaton, you can't do so again until you finish a long rest or until you expend a spell slot of 1st-level or higher to create another one. You can have one Automaton at a time, creating a second causes the first to fall apart.

Automatons are magical constructs with an Armor Class equal to 12 + your Intelligence modifier, and hit points equal to your artificer level + your Intelligence modifier. When they make an ability check or a saving throw, its ability scores are 10 (+0). If mending is cast on it, it regains 2d6 hit points. It disappears if it is reduced to 0 hit points or after 1 hour.

When you create you Automaton, you decide which type it is, choosing from the options on the table below. As a bonus action on your turn, you can activate the Automaton if you are within 60 feet. As part that bonus action, you can direct the Automaton to walk up to 25 feet to an unoccupied space.

td.em: You can see and hear through the senses of your Automaton, so long as you are within 100 feet. You are deaf and blind to your senses until you end this link as a bonus action.
The Automaton latches onto a creature within 5 feet, reducing the target's movement speed by a number of feet equal to 5 times your Intelligence modifier (minimum of 5 feet).
The Automaton attaches itself to a willing creature within 5 feet. While attached, the creature's Armor Class cannot be less than 13 + your Intelligence modifier.
The Automaton gains proficiency in one set of tools, and adds your Intelligence modifier to any check it makes using that set of tools.
The Automaton makes a melee spell attack against a creature within 5 feet. On hit, it deals bludgeoning damage equal to 1d6 + your Intelligence modifier.

sheet.description: Use your smith's tools at the end of a long rest to create a Small Automaton from the Automation Model table; you can also expend a 1st-level spell slot to do so before resting, though you can only have one at a time. It lasts for 1 hr. or until it reaches 0 hit points. Your Automaton has AC {{automaton:ac}} and {{automaton:hp}} hit points, and all ability scores of 10. It regains 2d6 hit points if mending is cast on it. You can use a bonus action to activate your Automaton within 60 ft. and have it walk up to 25 ft.

Use your smith's tools at the end of a long rest to create two Small Automatons from the Automation Model table; you can also expend a 1st-level spell slot to create one before resting, though you can only have two at a time. It lasts for 1 hr. or until it reaches 0 hit points. Your Automaton has AC {{automaton:ac}} and {{automaton:hp}} hit points, and all ability scores of 10. It regains 2d6 hit points if mending is cast on it. You can use a bonus action to activate your Automaton within 60 ft. and have it walk up to 25 ft.

Use your smith's tools at the end of a long rest to create two Small Automatons from the Automation Model table; you can also expend a spell slot to create a number of Automatons equal to the slot's level, though you can only have two at a time. They last for 1 hr. or until they reach 0 hit points. Your Automatons have AC {{automaton:ac}} and {{automaton:hp}} hit points, and all ability scores of 10. They regain 2d6 hit points if mending is cast on them. You can use a bonus action to activate an Automaton within 60 ft. and have it walk up to 25 ft.

Use your smith's tools at the end of a long rest to create three Small Automatons from the Automation Model table; you can also expend a spell slot to create a number of Automatons equal to the slot's level, though you can only have three at a time. They last for 1 hr. or until they reach 0 hit points. Your Automatons have AC {{automaton:ac}} and {{automaton:hp}} hit points, and all ability scores of 10. They regain 2d6 hit points if mending is cast on them. You can use a bonus action to activate an Automaton within 60 ft. and have it walk up to 25 ft.

description.p: You can see and hear through the senses of your Automaton, so long as you are within 100 feet. You are deaf and blind to your senses until you end this link as a bonus action.

sheet.description: See and hear through the Automaton's senses while within 100 ft.; you yourself are deaf and blind until you use a bonus action to end the link.

description.p: The Automaton latches onto a creature within 5 feet, reducing the target's movement speed by a number of feet equal to 5 times your Intelligence modifier (minimum of 5 feet).

sheet.description: The Automaton latches onto a creature within 5 ft. and reduces its movement speed by {{anchor weight}} ft.

description.p: The Automaton attaches itself to a willing creature within 5 feet. While attached, the creature's Armor Class cannot be less than 13 + your Intelligence modifier.

sheet.description: The Automaton attaches itself to a willing creature within 5 ft., granting it a minimum AC of {{automaton armor:ac}} while attached.

description.p: The Automaton gains proficiency in one set of tools, and adds your Intelligence modifier to any check it makes using that set of tools.

sheet.description: The Automaton gains proficiency in a tool set and adds +{{intelligence:modifier}} to checks using those tools.

description.p: The Automaton makes a melee spell attack against a creature within 5 feet. On hit, it deals bludgeoning damage equal to 1d6 + your Intelligence modifier.

sheet.description: The Automaton make a melee spell attack against a creature within 5 ft., dealing 1d6 + {{intelligence:modifier}} bludgeoning damage on hit.

description.p: At 3rd level, you gain proficiency with smith's tools. If you already proficient in smith's tools, you gain proficiency with another set of artisan's tools of your choice.

td.em: cloud of daggers, cordon of arrows

description.p: Beginning at 5th level, you learn to channel magic through your Automatons. When you cast an artificer spell, you can choose for the spell to originate from an Automaton, instead of yourself so long as you are within 60 feet of it.
When you cast a spell in this way, you roll a d8, and add the number rolled to one damage, or healing, roll of the spell.

sheet.description: When you cast an artificer spell, you can choose for it to originate from your Automaton while within 60 ft. of it; +1d8 to its damage or healing if cast this way.

description.p: You can create and control Automatons even more efficiently. Starting at 5th level, you can control up to two Automatons at one time, and at the end of each long rest you can create two Automatons of your choice, without expending a spell slot.

Starting at 9th level, when you expend an artificer spell slot to create an Automaton, you create a number of Automatons equal to the level of the spell slot expended. You cannot use this feature to exceed your maximum number of Automatons.

You have become a master amongst Machinist artificers. Starting at 15th level, you can control up to three Automatons at one time, and at the end of a long rest you create three Automatons of your choice, without expending a spell slot.

Also, when you are forced to make a saving throw or are hit by an attack, you can use your reaction to switch places with one of your Automatons within 60 feet. The Automaton then becomes the target of the attack or saving throw.

sheet.description: When you are foced to make a saving throw or are hit by an attack, switch places with an Automaton within 60 ft., making it the new target of the attack or saving throw.

description.p: Though all artificers have their quirks, Puppeteers tend to be the strangest subset of arcane inventors. They dedicate their research and intellect towards mastery of manipulation and control of other creatures through the use of their Marionette Strings. Often found literally pulling the strings from behind the scenes, these strange artificers prefer to empower their allies rather than risk their own lives on the front lines.

sheet.description: Puppeteers prefer to empower their allies rather than risk their own lives on the front lines.

description.p: At 3rd level, you gain proficiency with weaver's tools. If you are already proficient with weaver's tools, you instead gain proficiency with another set of artisan's tools of your choice.

At 3rd level, you learn to fashion the strange Strings that mark you as a Puppeteer. When you finish a long rest, you can use your weaver's tools to construct a set of Marionette Strings, usable only by you. As an action, you can cause your Strings to fly out and magically attach to a willing creature within 30 feet. You must have a free hand to use your Strings.

While a creature is attached to your Strings, you gain the features listed below. Your Marionette Strings detach after 1 minute, if you use a bonus action to detach them, or if you and the creature are ever more than 30 feet apart.
You can attach your Marionette Strings a number of times equal to your Intelligence modifier (minimum of once), and you regain all expended uses when you finish a long rest.

Corrected Strike. When the attached creature makes a melee attack, you can use your reaction to have them re-roll their attack roll, and they must use the new roll. You must use this reaction before you know if the attack hits or misses.
Channel Spell. As an action on your turn, you can cast an artificer spell as if it originated from the attached creature. If the spell requires concentration, you concentrate on it.

Puppeteer's Guidance. When the attached creature makes an ability check that uses a skill with which you are proficient, you can grant them a bonus to their roll equal to your Intelligence modifier (minimum of +1).

Strange Movement. As a bonus action on your turn, you can move the attached creature a number of feet equal to 5 times your Intelligence modifier (minimum of 5 feet). This movement does not provoke opportunity attacks.

The degree of control you exert through your Strings grows. Starting at 5th level, when the creature attached to your Marionette Strings makes an attack, you can use your reaction to cause them to make one additional attack.

In addition, when a creature attached to your Strings hits a creature with a melee attack, you can expend a spell slot to empower their strike. Their strike deals an additional 2d6 force damage for a 1st-level spell slot, and an additional 1d6 force damage for each spell slot level above 1st.

Your ability to control and amplify the abilities of others has increased. Starting at 9th level, you can have two creatures attached to separate Marionette Strings at one time. You must have a free hand to control each of these creatures. The two creatures can be any distance apart, so long as they each individually remain within the range of your Strings.
In addition, the length of your Marionette Strings, and the range of your Puppeteer abilities, becomes 60 feet.

You have become a master amongst Puppeteer artificers. Starting at 15th level, you can use an action on your turn to cast the Irresistible Dance spell, without expending a spell slot, or requiring your concentration. You can only have once instance of this spell active at a time. When a creature makes a saving throw to resist the spell, you can expend a use of your Marionette Strings to impose disadvantage.
Once you cast Irresistible Dance in this way, you must finish a long rest before you can do so again, or expend a use of your Marionette Strings ability to use this ability again.

sheet.description: Cast Otto's Irresistable Dance without a spell slot or requiring concentration; you can only have on instance of it active at a time. When a creature makes a saving throw to resist it, you can expend a use of Marionette Strings to impose disadvantage. You can also expend a use to reuse this feature before a long rest.

description.p: Alchemy is a delicate art, tip the ratio of ingredients too far out of line and the effects could be disastrous. Those that study the magic of arcane potions and brews are known as Alchemists. They are experts at combining exotic reagents to produce a variety of materials and effects. From healing droughts that can mend a wound in moments, to sticky goo that explodes when it comes in contact with open flame. With careful preparation, and a bit of luck, Alchemists are masters of both giving life and leeching it away.

sheet.description: Alchemists are masters of both giving life and leeching it away.

description.p: At 3rd level, you gain proficiency with alchemist's supplies. If you are already proficient with alchemist's supplies, you gain proficiency with another set of artisan's tools of your choice.

Beginning at 3rd level, at the end of each long rest, you can use your alchemist's supplies produce an Elixir in an empty flask you touch. At creation, you choose the Elixir's effect from the table below, some of which include your proficiency bonus (PB). The effect of an Elixir is triggered when someone drinks the Elixir. As a bonus action, a creature can drink the Elixir or administer it to a creature within 5 feet. A creature can only be under the effects of one Elixir at a time, and drinking another immediately ends any other Elixir effects.
Any Elixir you create through this feature lasts until it is consumed, or until the end of your next long rest.
As an action on your turn, you can expend a spell slot of 1st-level or higher to create an Elixir in an empty flask you touch. You can use the Elixir as part of the same action.
At certain levels in this class, you can make more Elixirs at the end of a long rest: at 6th level (two), and 15th level (three).

td.em: The drinker is transformed as if by the alter self spell. They determine the effect of the spell, which lasts for 10 minutes.
The drinker can add 1d4 to any attack rolls and saving throws they make for 1 minute.
The drinker gains a flying speed equal to 5 times your PB in feet for 10 minutes.
The drinker regains a number of hit points equal to PB(d4) + your Intelligence Modifier.
The drinker gains a bonus to their Armor Class equal to half your PB for 10 minutes.
The drinker's speed increases by a number of feet equal to 5 times your PB for 1 hour.

sheet.description: Use your alchemist's supplies to create an Elixir at the end of a long rest, or use an action on your turn and expend a 1st-level spell slot to create one by touching an empty flask; you can drink it as part of the same action. The effects of an Elixir trigger upon consumption, and they can be consumed or adinistered to a creature within 5 ft. as a bonus action. Creatures can only be under one Elixir's effects a ta time.

Use your alchemist's supplies to create two Elixirs at the end of a long rest, or use an action on your turn and expend a 1st-level spell slot to create one by touching an empty flask; you can drink it as part of the same action. The effects of an Elixir trigger upon consumption, and they can be consumed or adinistered to a creature within 5 ft. as a bonus action. Creatures can only be under one Elixir's effects a ta time.

Use your alchemist's supplies to create two Elixirs at the end of a long rest, or use an action on your turn and expend a 1st-level spell slot to create one by touching an empty flask; you can drink it as part of the same action. The effects of an Elixir trigger upon consumption, and they can be consumed or adinistered to a creature within 5 ft. as a bonus action. Drinking an Elixir grants 2d6 + {{intelligence:modifier}} temporary hit points. Creatures can only be under one Elixir's effects a ta time.

Use your alchemist's supplies to create three Elixirs at the end of a long rest, or use an action on your turn and expend a 1st-level spell slot to create one by touching an empty flask; you can drink it as part of the same action. The effects of an Elixir trigger upon consumption, and they can be consumed or adinistered to a creature within 5 ft. as a bonus action. Drinking an Elixir grants 2d6 + {{intelligence:modifier}} temporary hit points. Creatures can only be under one Elixir's effects a ta time.

sheet.description: Transform as if by the alter self spell for 10 minutes.

sheet.description: +1d4 to attack rolls and saving throws for 1 minute.

sheet.description: Gain {{flight elixir speed}} ft.-flying distance for 10 minutes.

sheet.description: +{{proficiency:half}} AC for 10 minutes.

sheet.description: +{{swiftness elixir speed}} for 1 hour.

description.p: Starting at 5th level, when you cast an artificer spell that deals acid, fire, necrotic, or poison damage, or restores hit points, you gain a bonus to the damage, or healing, roll equal to your Intelligence modifier (minimum of +1).

sheet.description: +{{intelligence:modifier}} to the damage dealt by artificer spells that deal fire, necrotic, or poison damage, and +{{intelligence:modifier}} healing to artificer spells that restore hit points.

description.p: Beginning at 9th level, whenever a creature drinks one of your Elixirs, they gain temporary hit points equal to 2d6 + your Intelligence modifier, in addition to the Elixir's effect.
Also, you can cast lesser restoration without expending a spell slot, even if you don't have it prepared, provided you use your alchemist's supplies as the spellcasting focus.
You can cast lesser restoration in this way a number of times equal to your Intelligence modifier (minimum of once), and you regain all expended uses when you finish a long rest.

sheet.description: Cast lesser restoration without expending a spell slot, even if you don't have it prepared, using your alchemist's supplies as the focus.

description.p: ou have become a master among Alchemist artificers. Upon reaching 15th level, you gain resistance to acid and poison damage, and immunity to the poisoned condition.

In addition, you can cast both greater restoration and heal without expending a spell slot, without preparing the spell, and without providing the material component, provided you use your alchemist’s supplies as the spellcasting focus.
You can cast each of these spells once with this feature, and you must finish a long rest before you can do so again.

sheet.description: Cast greater restoration or heal without expending a spell slot or providing the material components using your alchemist's supplies as the focus, once each per long rest.

p.em: Item: a set of artisan's tools (requires attunement)

description.p: The wielder is considered proficient with this magical set of tools, and as an action, they can transform this set of tools into another set of artisan's tools of their choice.

sheet.description: You can infuse a set of tools into a magical one, granting its user proficiency with it and allowing them to transform it into another set of tools as an action.

p.em: Item: a rod or wand

description.p: This tiny length of wood is infused with an artificer cantrip of your choice. As an action, a creature can produce the imbued cantrip, using your spellcasting modifier to cast the spell.

sheet.description: You can infuse a rod or wand with an artificer cantrip, allowing its wielder to produce that cantrip with your spellcasting modifier as an action.

p.em: Item: a glove or gauntlet

description.p: This tiny magical launcher can be loaded with a Tiny object (for example: ball bearings, a vial of acid, alchemist's fire, or holy water). As a bonus action the wearer can activate the launcher and make a ranged attack at a target within 20 feet. The launcher can be reloaded as an action.

sheet.description: You can infuse a glove or gauntlet to allow it to be loaded with a Tiny object, which can then be fired with a bonus action as a 20-ft. ranged attack and reloaded as an action.

p.em: Item: a musical instrument (requires attunement)

description.p: This instrument has been magically enhanced by artifice. The wielder is considered proficient with this instrument and can use it as a spellcasting focus. Whenever they make an ability check using this instrument, they gain a bonus to the roll equal to your Intelligence modifier (minimum of +1).
At 10th level this magic instrument grants a +1 bonus to spell attack rolls. This bonus increases to +2 at 14th level.

sheet.description: You can infuse a musicla instrument, granting its user proficiency and the ability to use it as a spellcasting focus; they gain +{{intelligence:modifier}} to ability checks with it.

You can infuse a musicla instrument, granting its user proficiency and the ability to use it as a spellcasting focus; they gain +{{intelligence:modifier}} to ability checks with it and +1 to spell attack rolls.

You can infuse a musicla instrument, granting its user proficiency and the ability to use it as a spellcasting focus; they gain +{{intelligence:modifier}} to ability checks with it and +2 to spell attack rolls.

p.em: Item: a belt or cloak (requires attunement)

description.p: When worn, this magic belt reduces the user to one-tenth of their weight without decreasing their physical abilities.
At 10th level it reduces the wearer to one-hundredth of their weight without decreasing their physical abilities.

sheet.description: You can infuse a belt that grants its wearer a 90% weight reduction with no impact to physical abilities.
You can infuse a belt that grants its wearer a 99% weight reduction with no impact to physical abilities.

p.em: Item: a heavy or two-handed (requires attunement)

description.p: This magic weapon no longer has either the heavy or two-handed property (your choice upon infusion).
At 10th level this weapon grants a +1 bonus to attack and damage rolls. This bonus becomes +2 at 14th level.

sheet.description: You can infuse a heavy or two-handed weapon to remove one of the two properties.
You can infuse a heavy or two-handed weapon to remove one of the two properties; it also grants +1 to attack and damage rolls.
You can infuse a heavy or two-handed weapon to remove one of the two properties; it also grants +2 to attack and damage rolls.

p.em: Item: a pair of goggles or glasses

description.p: While wearing these goggles, the wearer can see through lightly obscured areas without disadvantage on Wisdom (Perception) checks. In addition, the wearer no longer suffers the negative effects from the Sunlight Sensitivity trait, and they have advantage on saving throws to resist being blinded.

sheet.description: You can infuse a pair of glasses or goggles to see through lightly obscured areas without disadvantage on Wisdom (Perception) checks, negate the negative effects of the Sunlight Sensitivity trait, and grant advantage on saving throws against being blinded.

p.em: Item: a whip or chain

description.p: This magic weapon grants a +1 bonus to attack and damage rolls made with it, and it's damage die increases to 1d8.
This bonus increases at 10th level (+2) and 14th level (+3).

sheet.description: You can infuse a whip or chain to grant it +1 to attack and damage rolls and increase its damage die to 1d8.
You can infuse a whip or chain to grant it +2 to attack and damage rolls and increase its damage die to 1d8.
You can infuse a whip or chain to grant it +3 to attack and damage rolls and increase its damage die to 1d8.

p.em: Item: a pair of boots (requires attunement)

description.p: When the user is standing on a flat surface, they can use an action to activate the boots, magically fixing the user in place. Until you use an action to deactivate the boots, you do not move, even if you are defying gravity.
A creature can use an action to make a DC 30 Strength check, separating your boots from the surface on a success.

sheet.description: You can infuse a pair of boots to grant their wearer the ability to use an action to activate them and fix themselves in place, even in a gravity-defying situation; creatures trying to move them must make a DC 30 Strength check to do so until you deactivate them.

p.em: Item: a sword hilt or wand (requires attunement)

description.p: While grasping the item, the wielder can use a bonus action to cause a blade of pure radiance to spring into existence, or dissapear, from the end of the item. While the blade exists, this magic item is a simple weapon with the finesse property. The luminous blade emits bright light in a 15-foot radius and dim light for an additional 15 feet. The light is sunlight.

The wielder gains a +1 bonus to attack and damage rolls made with this weapon, which deals 1d8 radiant damage on hit. Undead take an additional 1d8 radiant damage. The bonus to attack and damage rolls becomes +2 at 15th level.

sheet.description: You can infuse a sword hilt or wand to grant its wielder the ability to use a bonus action and to summon (or dismiss) a blade of light that emits bright sunlight in a 15-ft. radius and dim sunlight for another 15 ft.; it is a magic simple finesse weapon with a +1 bonus to attack and damage rolls, and deals 1d8 radiant damage on hit. Undead take an additional 1d8 radiant damage.

You can infuse a sword hilt or wand to grant its wielder the ability to use a bonus action and to summon (or dismiss) a blade of light that emits bright sunlight in a 15-ft. radius and dim sunlight for another 15 ft.; it is a magic simple finesse weapon with a +2 bonus to attack and damage rolls, and deals 1d8 radiant damage on hit. Undead take an additional 1d8 radiant damage.

p.em: Item: a pair of gloves hilt or gauntlets (requires attunement)

description.p: These magical gauntlets have 4 charges. When the wearer hits a creature with an unarmed strike they can expend 1 charge and force the target to make a Strength saving throw. On a failed save, the creature is knocked back 15 feet. The gauntlets regain all expended charges at dawn.
At 9th level this magic weapon grants a +1 bonus to attack and damage rolls. This bonus increases to +2 at 15th level.

sheet.description: You can infuse a pair of gloves or gauntlets to grant it 4 charges, restoring at dawn, of the ability to expend a charge upon hitting a creature with an unarmed strike to force it to make a Strength saving throw; if it fails, it is knocked back 15 ft.

You can infuse a pair of gloves or gauntlets to grant it +1 to attack and damage rolls and 4 charges, restoring at dawn, of the ability to expend a charge upon hitting a creature with an unarmed strike to force it to make a Strength saving throw; if it fails, it is knocked back 15 ft.

You can infuse a pair of gloves or gauntlets to grant it +2 to attack and damage rolls and 4 charges, restoring at dawn, of the ability to expend a charge upon hitting a creature with an unarmed strike to force it to make a Strength saving throw; if it fails, it is knocked back 15 ft.

p.em: Item: a cloak, vest, or harness

description.p: This magic harness automatically sizes to fit the wearer, and can be worn over clothing or light armor. It has wing-like fins between your limbs that can slow your fall or allow you to glide. When you fall, and aren't incapacitated, you subtract up to 100 feet from your fall when calculating falling damage, and can move 2 feet horizontally every 1 foot you fall.

sheet.description: You can infuse a cloak, vest, or harness to slow the wearer's fall and allow it to glide; the wearer can subtract 100 ft. from fall damage calculation and move 2 ft. horizontally for each foot descended.

p.em: Item: an armored gauntlet and a martial weapon or shield

description.p: You attach either a martial weapon lacking the heavy or two handed properties, or a shield to the gauntlet. The wearer gains proficiency with the attached item, and it cannot be removed from the gauntlet while this Infusion is active.

sheet.description: You can infuse both armored gauntlet and a martial weapon or shield to attach them; the gauntlet's wielder gains proficiency with the attached item, which cannot be removed while the Infusion is active.

p.em: Item: a suit of armor (requires attunement)

description.p: This armor has 4 charges. While wearing this magical armor the wearer can use an action to expend charges and cast one of the following spells, targeting only themselves: invisibility (2 charges) or greater invisibility (4 charges). This armor regains all expended charges daily at dawn.

sheet.description: You can infuse a suit of armor to grant it four charges (recharging at dawn) that the wearer can expend to cast, targeting only themselves, invisibility (2 charges) or greater invisibility (4 charges).

p.em: Item: a metal circlet or collar

description.p: The magic of this collar can tame even the wildest of animals. You, and only you, can control any beast wearing this collar as if it were a trained mount. This collar does not work on beasts with an Intelligence score greater than your own.
At 15th level, this magic collar allows you to control any monstrosity with an Intelligence score of 5 or lower.

sheet.description: You can infuse a metal circlet or collar to grant it the ability to tame any beast with an Intelligence equal to or lower than your own wearing it as if it were a trained mount, for you only.

You can infuse a metal circlet or collar to grant it the ability to tame any beast with an Intelligence equal to or lower than your own, or any Monstrosity with 5 or lower Intelligence, wearing it as if it were a trained mount, for you only.

p.em: Item: a melee weapon (requires attunement)

description.p: You infuse a weapon with elemental energy. Upon infusion, choose a command word and one of the following damage types: acid, cold, fire, poison, or lightning. As a bonus action, the wielder can speak the command word and cause elemental energy to burst forth from the weapon until the command word is spoken again. On hit, the weapon deals an additional 1d4 of the elemental damage.
The additional damage becomes 1d6 at 14th level.

sheet.description: You can infuse a melee weapon with elemental energy; choose either acid, cold, fire, poison, or lightning. As a bonus action the wielder can activate the infusion and deal an additional 1d4 of that damage type on hit.

You can infuse a melee weapon with elemental energy; choose either acid, cold, fire, poison, or lightning. As a bonus action the wielder can activate the infusion and deal an additional 1d6 of that damage type on hit.

p.em: Item: a suit of armor (requires attunement)

description.p: This magic suit of armor has 4 charges. As an action, the wearer can expend a charge to cast the enlarge/reduce spell, targeting only themselves, without expending a spell slot or requiring concentration. Re-casting the spell with the armor ends the effect. This armor regains all charges at dawn.

sheet.description: You can infuse a suit of armor with 4 charges (recharging at dawn) that the wearer can, as an action, expend to cast enlarge/reduce targeting themselves without expending a spell slot or concentrating; they can recast to end the effect.

p.em: Item: a ring (requires attunement)

description.p: Upon infusing this magic ring you select one of the following damage types: acid, cold, fire, poison, lightning, or thunder.
When the wearer casts a spell that deals the damage type that you selected, they can activate this ring to deal maximum damage to one target of the spell instead of rolling.
Once this ring is activated it cannot be used again until the wearer completes a short or long rest.

sheet.description: You can infuse a ring with one of acid, cold, fire, poison, lightning, or thunder; when the wearer casts a spell dealing that damage type, they can activate the ring once per rest to deal maximum damage to one of the spell's targets instead of rolling.

p.em: Item: a melee weapon (requires attunement)

description.p: You enchant a weapon to drain life from enemies. When the wielder scores a critical hit with this weapon, the target takes an additional 2d6 necrotic damage, so long as the target is not a construct or undead. The wielder gains temporary hit points equal to the extra necrotic damage dealt.
When you reach 14th level, the additional necrotic damage from this Infusion increases to 4d6.

sheet.description: You can infuse a melee weapon to drain life; when its wielder scores a critical hit, as long as the target is not a construct or undead, it takes an additional 2d6 necrotic damage which is granted to the wielder as temporary hit points.

You can infuse a melee weapon to drain life; when its wielder scores a critical hit, as long as the target is not a construct or undead, it takes an additional 4d6 necrotic damage which is granted to the wielder as temporary hit points.

p.em: Item: a helm, hat, or diadem (requires attunement)

description.p: The wearer of this magic helm is resistant to psychic damage, immune to the charmed and frightened conditions, and any magic that allows another creature to read their thoughts or telepathically communicate with them.

sheet.description: You can infuse a helm, hat, or diadem to grant its wielder psychic damage resistance, charmed and frightened immunities, and immunity to having their thoughts read or being telepathically communicated with.

description.p: You have discovered the secrets to the creation of life. You learn the clone spell. It counts as an artificer spell for you, but it doesn't count against your number of Spells Known. You can cast clone without expending a spell slot as long as you have the material components available.
If you replace this Infusion with another at any point during the incubation period, the spell immediately fails.

sheet.description: You can cast clone without expending a spell slot as long as you have the material components.

p.em: Item: a melee weapon (requires attunement)

description.p: This item has 4 charges. While wielding this magic weapon, the user can use their action to cast the steel wind strike spell, using the Infused weapon as the spellcasting focus, without expending a spell slot. The weapon regains all expended charges at the end of a long rest.

sheet.description: You can infuse a melee weapon with 4 charges (regained after a long rest) that the wielder can expend with an action to cast steel wind strike, using the weapon as the focus, without expending a spell slot.

p.em: Item: a ranged weapon (requires attunement)

description.p: While wielding this magic weapon, the user can use their action to cast swift quiver, using the Infused weapon as the spellcasting focus, without expending a spell slot.
Once activated, the wielder must finish a short or long rest before they can cast swift quiver with this weapon again.

sheet.description: You can infuse a ranged weapon with the ability (regained after a short rest) to cast swift quiver as an action, using the weapon as the focus, without expending a spell slot.
